metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML Entities
Reserved characters in HTML must be replaced with entities:
content.html: Reserved characters in HTML must be replaced with entities:

content.text: HTML Character Entities
Some characters are reserved in HTML.
content.html: Some characters are reserved in HTML.

content.text: If you use the less than (<) or greater than (>) signs in your HTML text, the browser might mix them with tags.
content.html: If you use the less than (<) or greater than (>) signs in your HTML text, the browser might mix them with tags.

content.text: Entity names or entity numbers can be used to display reserved HTML characters.
content.html: Entity names or entity numbers can be used to display reserved HTML characters.

content.text: Entity names look like this:
content.html: Entity names look like this:

content.text: Entity numbers look like this:
content.html: Entity numbers look like this:

content.text: To display a less than sign (<) we must write: < or <
content.html: To display a less than sign (<) we must write: < or <

content.text: Entity names are easier to remember than entity numbers.
content.html: Entity names are easier to remember than entity numbers.

content.text: Non-breaking Space
A commonly used HTML entity is the non-breaking space:
content.html: A commonly used HTML entity is the non-breaking space:

content.text: A non-breaking space is a space that will not break into a new line.
content.html: A non-breaking space is a space that will not break into a new line.

content.text: Two words separated by a non-breaking space will stick together (not break into a new line). This is handy when breaking the words might be disruptive.
content.html: Two words separated by a non-breaking space will stick together (not break into a new line). This is handy when breaking the words might be disruptive.

content.text: Examples:
content.html: Examples:

content.text: Another common use of the non-breaking space is to prevent browsers from truncating spaces in HTML pages.
content.html: Another common use of the non-breaking space is to prevent browsers from truncating spaces in HTML pages.

content.text: If you write 10 spaces in your text, the browser will remove 9 of them. To add real spaces to your text, you can use the   character entity.
content.html: If you write 10 spaces in your text, the browser will remove 9 of them. To add real spaces to your text, you can use the   character entity.

content.text: The non-breaking hyphen ( ‑ ) is used to define a hyphen character (‑) that does not break into a new line.
content.html: The non-breaking hyphen (‑) is used to define a hyphen character (‑) that does not break into a new line.

content.text: Some Useful HTML Character Entities

content.code_html:
Result Description Name Number
non-breaking space     Try it »
< less than < < Try it »
> greater than > > Try it »
& ampersand & & Try it »
" double quotation mark " " Try it »
' single quotation mark ' ' Try it »
¢ cent ¢ ¢ Try it »
£ pound £ £ Try it »
¥ yen ¥ ¥ Try it »
€ euro € € Try it »
© copyright © © Try it »
® registered trademark ® ® Try it »
™ trademark ™ ™ Try it »

content.text: Note
Entity names are case sensitive.
content.html: Entity names are case sensitive.

content.text: Combining Diacritical Marks
A diacritical mark is a "glyph" added to a letter.
content.html: A diacritical mark is a "glyph" added to a letter.

content.text: Some diacritical marks, like grave ( ̀) and acute ( ́) are called accents.
content.html: Some diacritical marks, like grave (  ̀) and acute (  ́) are called accents.

content.text: Diacritical marks can be used in combination with alphanumeric characters to produce a character that is not present in the character set (encoding) used in the page.
content.html: Diacritical marks can be used in combination with alphanumeric characters to produce a character that is not present in the character set (encoding) used in the page.

content.text: Here are some examples:
content.html: Here are some examples:

content.code_html:
Mark Character Construct Result
 ̀ a à à Try it »
 ́ a á á Try it »
̂ a â â Try it »
 ̃ a ã ã Try it »
 ̀ O Ò Ò Try it »
 ́ O Ó Ó Try it »
̂ O Ô Ô Try it »
 ̃ O Õ Õ Try it »

content.text: There are more examples in the next chapter.
content.html: There are more examples in the next chapter.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the entity name that represents a less than < sign?
content.html: What is the entity name that represents a less than < sign?
